thread.title: Ilayathalapathy fans, it's time to celebrate as Vijay's 61st film with Atlee goes on floors on February 1 - Bollywoodlife.com
thread.title_full: Ilayathalapathy fans, it's time to celebrate as Vijay's 61st film with Atlee goes on floors on February 1 - Bollywoodlife.com

author: Karthika Raveendran
title: Ilayathalapathy fans, it's time to celebrate as Vijay's 61st film with Atlee goes on floors on February 1 - Bollywoodlife.com
text:
Samantha Ruth Prabhu, Rana Daggubati, Sonu Sood: Know these South Celebrities New Year plans 
Ilayathalapathy fans, are you ready for the next big thing? According to the latest reports, Vijay’s much talked about project will go on floors on February 1st, that is tomorrow. The first schedule will begin with Vijay and Jyothika . As per reports on sify, this schedule will have sets form the 80s which tells us, the movie might be set in different time periods. The movie also stars two other female leads – Kajal Aggarwal and Samantha Ruth Prabhu. Apart from its power packed main lead cast, the supporting cast holds as much promise – Sathyaraj, Vadivelu, SJ Suryah will be part of this film. It might be Vijay’s 61st project but it’s the production house – Sri Thendal Films’ 100th project. C Sundar’s Sanghamitra was to be their 100th film, but as its pre-production got delayed, they went ahead with Vijay’s film. The makers are planning to shoot across UK, US and north India. They have also roped in AR Rahman to compose the music. We are super excited after all Vijay is teaming up Atlee once again. They delivered the blockbuster film – Their last year. We can’t wait to find out what adventure they will take us on this time. 
Vijay’s last film was Bairavaa directed by Bharathan. While the film received mediocre reviews the movie managed to fared decently at the Tamil Nadu box office. However its collections were badly affected around the time of protests against the ban on Jallikattu. It was only because Suriya’s Singam 3 release got delayed, Vijay’s Bairavaa collection got a major boost in the 3rd week of its release. as of now, the movie has managed to rake in Rs 62 crore. While the other films that released during Pongal – Chiranjeevi’s Khaidi No. 150 and Nandamuri Balakrishna’s Gautamiputra Balakrishna fared phenomenally at the box office. In fact the former crossed the Rs 100 crore mark.
